page.title: 07TREES IN S.ELKINGTON PARKS
page.content: Three areas of parkland,many of the imported trees over 150 years old.In the old Elkington Hall park are 4 fine Cedars,2 Lebanons & 2 Deodars.There are also a fern leaved Beech, Brewer's Spruce,Sweet Chestnut,Limes,Black Walnut,Californian Redwoods and a Wellingtonia.By the lake are 2 Lucombe's Oak; in Lodge Lane a Turkey Oak.Several Corsican Pine and a pink Chestnut grow by the small lake.In the Vale,a wooded stream valley & old carriage way to the Hall,are the note worthy Coast Redwoods and two Western Red Cedars.Thorpe Hall park also has some fine trees,including Plane,a Black Pine and very old Spanish Oaks. Deighton Close a small parkland of mainly deciduous trees,including Copper Beech. In the churchyard,the thorny tree is the Honey Locust.
